    <metadata>

      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>

            <entry>cahi1:data_82637</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Electrolysis</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Elektrolyse</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Électrolyse</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Electrolysis</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Elettrolisi</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ηλεκτρόλυση</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Electrólisis</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows that in the process called electrolysis, molten or dissolved substances split up when electricity passes through them.</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">chlorine gas</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">copper chloride</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">copper metals</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">dissolved substances</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Electricity</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">electrolysis</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">molten substances</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">solutions</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt daß in den benannten 
Elektrolyse-, flüssigen oder aufgelöstenprozeßsubstanzen, die 
herauf aufgespaltet werden, wenn Elektrizität durch sie 
überschreitet.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration prouve que dans les substances
d'électrolyse, fondues ou dissoute appelées de processus 
fractionnées quand l'électricité traverse elles.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra que nas substâncias 
chamadas process do electrolysis, as derretidas ou dissolvido rachadas
acima de quando a eletricidade passa através delas.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione indica che nelle sostanze 
fuse o dissolta chiamate trattate di elettrolisi, scisse quando 
l'elettricità attraversa loro.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση δείχνει ότι στη διαδικασία κάλεσε 
τις λειωμένων ή διαλυμένη ουσίες ηλεκτρόλυσης, που χωρίστηκαν 
όταν περνά η ηλεκτρική ενέργεια μέσω τους.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra que en las sustancias 
llamadas de proceso de la electrólisis, fundidas o disuelto divididas
cuando la electricidad pasa a través de ellas.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Chlorgas</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">kupferne Chlorverbindung</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">kupferne Metalle</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">aufgelöste Substanzen</string>
          </keyword>
